topics.name: Key concepts in biology
subtopics: Health, disease and development of medicines

excluded_concepts: ATP (adenosine triphosphate) - not taught until A-level
Detailed biochemical pathways - save for A-level
Complex protein synthesis mechanisms - basic only at GCSE
Gene regulation and expression - beyond GCSE scope
Detailed cellular respiration cycles (Krebs cycle, electron transport chain) - A-level content
Advanced genetics (epistasis, linkage, sex linkage) - A-level only
Detailed plant transport mechanisms - keep basic at GCSE
Advanced ecology concepts (nitrogen cycle details) - A-level content
Detailed enzyme kinetics and competitive/non-competitive inhibition - A-level
Complex evolutionary mechanisms - basic evolution only at GCSE
level_restrictions.solution_guidance: Solutions must stay within GCSE level concepts. Avoid explaining biological processes using ATP, detailed biochemical pathways, or complex molecular mechanisms. Focus on basic processes, simple explanations, and observable phenomena. Use simple terminology and avoid university-level biochemistry.
